title: USS Arizona Memorial, Honolulu
address: 1 Arizona Memorial Place, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96818
review_list:
Booked my ticket for launch before I went. And you have to be there an hour before your slot. I was there in plenty time and was offered an earlier time. Which I took.
The film is informative and the park and museum give you an insight into the events and build up to the pearl harbour attacks.
A must...


More  



Truly informative.I booked on line but not necessary, USN and Ranger are very helpful. Go and learn a history.

A very moving experience visiting the memorial. A disappointment that some of the other visitors were not as respectful of the experience.

This was my third time visiting and it is always a moving great historic site. As a retired military veteran it really means more to those that have served our great country.

Well worth a visit ,See Pearl Harbour, see the museum, Check out the aviation Museum, well worth it, Bookings essential

If you are in Honolulu this is a must see. We were picked up at our hotel and told what to expect throughout the day. In booking the tour we were also given information on what could be taken inside for the tour and what we couldn't take. The entire trip was very interesting and very moving to see. But...

Memorable. Emotive. Top atraccion in Hawaii. Get there earl so that you can then visit ghe other sites. Go freelance take a taxi or car if in a small group so you aren`t fixed to a tour schedule.

A very moving experience. The way the history of Pearl Harbor is presented takes you back to the days of the events,

A day that will live in infamy
A visit to the USS Arizona is a moving, memorable and influential event. Whatever your knowledge of what happened at Pearl Harbor, visitng the USS Arizona is an intensely human experience. Take time to visit the USS Arizona - it may change you forever.
The experience lasts an hour and 15 minutes. There...


More  



I was born & raised in Hawaii, yet have never been here until last month. It was a walk through history for me, and to remember and honor those we lost & survived that day. A very humbling experience. FYI at the entry no handbags, camera bags or backpacks allowed at entry. They do have a storage for a fee...

title: Pearl Harbor / WW II Valor in the Pacific National Monument, Honolulu
address: 1 Arizona Memorial Place, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96818
review_list:
The cheap truth about Pearl Harbor. First of all, what you want to see is the USS Arizona Memorial. This is a memorial (white building) that was built over the sunken USS Arizona battleship. Entry to this memorial is free. You have to go online and make a reservation. Make sure to go to the correct website pacifichistoricparks.org. If you...


More  



A must if visiting Honolulu.History all around you. Lots to see and experience.Get there earlh to avoid the crowds and hot weather. If in small groups take taxi or car so you won`t be fixed to a schedule.

Visit early to see everything. We made the mistake of getting there at 11.30 and there were long queues for tickets. Expect to spend a full day there in order to see everything. Bags have to be left in a luggage section although small cameras are allowed.

Locals, visitors from the US and visitors from foreign countries must all spend time at this Memorial. Free-timed tickets can be purchased online in advance which is a great stress reducer!

This is by far the most moving tour to take. It is emotional and chilling to know all those poor souls gave up their life for our country. So proud of them.

This is a place that is worth a visit and to immerse yourself in the knowledge of history. For the kids it was mind-boggling as they saw the memorial and went to the various attractions around it.

Not much useful info on the website but worth the visit. Good movie for the USS Aizona. The Bowfin and Missouri are worth seeing too. The only food we found available was pre made sandwiches, hot dogs, and nacho chips. Be prepared to deal with Japanese rudeness bordering on irreverence.

Besides being one of the top tourist tracks attractions in the state of Hawaii, it is worth it. My recommendation is to go very early in the morning otherwise it gets warm and crowded. Three hours is plenty of time but if you are into history you might spend up to five hours.

It was a very interesting visit, lots of informations learnt during visiting, well organized and visitor oriented place.

Make sure to let them know if you are currently enlisted or veteran. They really care about people! My Grandfather served on this ship,and they made up feel like royalty. We were able too bring my 89 year old grandmother along! Amazing expierence.

title: Diamond Head State Monument, Honolulu
review_list:
To see Waikiki, Honolulu, the ocean and the magnific mountains of Oahu. To walk easily into a volcano,

This is a moderately challenging but doable hike for anyone without a fear of heights. The final leg is a bit daunting, so it's understandable that some end the trek at an overlook that provides a breathtaking view of Honolulu, Waikiki and the great Pacific. It can be hot, so take water.

Costs $1.00 per person, plus 5 dollars for a car, Scooters are free,Good walk up stairs through tunnels along tracks and finally up a spiral staircase. You can see for miles

Had a great time walking up with my family Diamond Head. 30 min aprox to get up to the look out. What a view. Near the top you don`t have to go up the spiral staircase. You can bypass that if you take a left turn.

Trail was easy to navigate and includes flat areas, inclines, and stairs. It was great exercise and the view from the top was awesome!

We did a family hike with the grandkids. It was nice & at the top the scene was beautiful. The steep stairs up got me...had to take a 10 minute break ;) Wear comfortable walking shoes, bring your bottled water & a camera.

After entering the park, you are in the bowl with desert like scenery. If you want a view, you must walk to the top. We thought a better view and option (without the hike) was at Punchbowl National Cemetery.

Walking in I saw at least 8 tour mini vans all labeled BWT. As I got to the area right before you start this hike around 7:25am, I saw a long line of Japanese tourist comng down. I mean, it was so crowded I really wanted to turn around and just say "screw this, I'll come back another time "......


More  



The view is well worth the hike. Take water with you and wear hiking footwear and sunscreen. Be prepared for a reasonable hiking effort - it's not long but there are some tiring uphill sections with a lot of steps.

Expect to get some exercise on this 0.8 mile hike. The hike starts on a sidewalk, but shortly up the hill it turns into an uneven stone path with several switchbacks as you climb to the top of the crater. Near the top you'll walk through a narrow, dimly-lit tunnel, and once you emerge you'll still have to climb the...

title: Battleship Missouri Memorial, Honolulu
review_list:
This battleship has been in many war situations and battles, the armor and guns are an amazing sight. You see all the living facilities, bridge and learn of the battles it had been involved in.

What a Magnificent Vessel, Inspiring history related to this Awesome Battleship worth the visit, gives you a perceptive on a great battleship.

Be part of history. As a kid I had a model of the Missouri. Now I was or her deck admiring her guns. Wow.What a ship.

This is the place the war ended. A fitting site overlooking the Arizona. The start and the end to a grime and historic period for our great country

The USS Missouri is unique for hosting the Japanese surrender, and no other ship can provide the experience of standing on that exact spot. That said, the Missouri is one of 4 Iowa class battleships that have been preserved. This one is probably the most visited and most crowded, and there is less access to interior spaces than most. For...


More  



What a wonderful day to finally see my father's ship. Everywhere we went we told them that our father was on the ship during the war. Our mother who is 89 was treated like royalty because her husband was on this ship. She was given a medal and a special box of chocolate by signing the guest book in our...


More  



We had a blast visiting this glorious ship! It makes your heart beat faster, that's how exciting just seeing it is. And it's history is very interesting for everybody.

After visiting the Arizona, you need to come to the Missouri. It's a great bookend ... WWII's beginning and end facing each other. Great opportunity to see a ship that served our Nation well in peace and war for five decades. Top to bottom of the ship, well presented.

This is a must see. Explore the ship and see how the crew lived. The exact spot of the Japanese reps signing the surrender documents is a must see. Watch you footing.

Loved this tour you have 3 decks to explore really wish the whole ship was open to roam. The audio tour is a little awkward with the 1980 bag phone looking device. Ship still smells like it did in the service. I could have spent the whole day there looking around. There is no time limit and you can move...

I suggest you bring your own snorkeling gear;...

I don't know how often the beach is closed, but luckily there are plenty of other beaches in the area and things to do. We arrived about 8 AM and the park was filling. When we left at 10:30 the line to get tickets was getting long and there were parking places left. Snorkeling is wonderful. You wade in and immediately see many varieties of colorful fish. Be aware that taxis are the largest commercial vehicle allowed in the park. If you go on...

Excellent time snorkeling with the family and enjoying the time on the beach. You could see all kinda fish and the water was great

Do not buy from street vendors there as they are toxic.

The visibility here is generally terrible. There are interesting creatures in the sea and you will see them but through a cloud of debris from the naturally occurring lichen-like sea plants that break off in the waves and muck up the water. We took an Uber to and from and walked the cemetery. We located an uncle of my husband, but also look at many others. There are so many "unknown". Go up to ten top to see some history, and the view.
They have a computer where you can look up those buried there.

This was my first visit to the "Punch Bowl" - I was surprised that this National Memorial Cemetery does not have the same white headstones that the others have. It's a beautiful cemetery with many monuments to those who served and died for our country. An added benefit to those not necessarily interested in the cemetery itself are the views...

As others have noted, this is a national cemetery operated by the VA like others throughout the nation. With such a somber undertone, I hesitate to call Punchbowl a top "attraction," so let's say it is something you should make a point of seeing. Maybe as good as the USS Arizona Memorial, but with a tiny fraction of the hassle. We got here courtest of our trusted Oahu Trailblazer book, after visiting the Tantalus Drive trails, which are...

The military cemetery is in a spectacular location and beautifully maintained, as you would expect.
A highlight is the mural depicting scenes from the war in the Pacific, during WW11 at the top of the steps. Fans of Hawaii 5-O will notice the angel guarding the entrance to the mural.

Easy to find with our phone mapping. Not crowded (10:00 a.m.) and found parking easily. Somber reminder of all those lives lost in war. Took about an hour to read the panels in counterclockwise order of each of the battles in the Pacific Theater of WWII, Korean Conflict and the Vietnam Conflict. Beautiful setting for the memorials among the rows...

Such a wonderful and serene memorial in the heart of a bustling oceanfront city. It was quite peaceful and humbling to walk around and view the headstones of the soldiers who have sacrificed for this country.
The grounds were impeccable and it was just as it should have been considering what it is. Five Stars!

Although I've lived in Honolulu for over 30 years, I've only been to Punchbowl once or twice before. Recently, a visiting friend asked to take flowers to his friend's father's grave. We drove around the whole area, found the right grave, arranged the flowers nicely, and really enjoyed the serenity of being inside Punchbowl. I will visit again soon for...

We visited the National Cemetery to visit the graves of the Forgotten 98. These civilians lost their lives on Wake Island in 1943. Few remember their sacrifice for our Country. Briefly visited this memorial whilst on a tour which included Pearl Harbour and the Missouri. Beautifully manicured grounds and well maintained memorials made this a fitting place in which to reflect about those who had given their lives in the service of their country.

title: USS Bowfin Submarine Museum & Park, Honolulu

review_list:
This attraction is very interesting for war buffs, it's a good look of life in a submarine atmosphere. There are headphones for different languages.

At Pearl Harbor il is a very instructive place to visit. To see how the marines were living and working on the submarine is quite special. We learn a lot of things from this visit.

This is a self-guided tour of a WWII era submarine. There is an audio tour available. I have experienced these audio tours before, and it is nice to get the oral history of it - but I prefer having little plaques I can read about what each room is. There was also an adjacent museum, but we did not go...

My two teen boys loved this kept them engage and asking lots of questions and inquiring about things for days later

But the history via audio tapes were tough to listen, as during those war days, it must have been tough for the folks on the submarine. It was raining on the day we went and as such we had a mixed reaction...

We really enjoyed the Bowfin tour, great value for the cost of admission. Our kids are a little young to tour the whole of pearl harbour but the Bowfin was a great introduction to what it all means. (7yr old and 5yr old).

It was very entertaining to visit USS Bowfin while in Pearl Harbor. Bit claustrophobic but definitely worth it.

Best to have the passport for all the exhibits at Pearl Harbor. This exhibit is a short walk from the main gate and visitor center. Excellent example of the submarine quarters and life under the sea. My 12 year old son is a WWII buff and loved this. I enjoyed it too and loved seeing him enjoying it so much. Sitting in the gunners seat....looking through the binoculars etc was great. Highly recommend to all

One of my favorite hikes if I want a quick cardio challenge and don't have much time. Be careful though if you go in the middle of the day, it gets really hot so bring enough water!

Absolutely awesome hike, not for the faint hearted. Difficult in some parts as the trail is uneven in some areas.Once you reach the top the rewards speak for themselves. title: Bishop Museum, Honolulu
review_list:
A great place to see the full history of Hawaii. Combine this with the Iolani Palace and you can explore the full history of Hawaii. They continually add to the museum, so if you've been here before you should stop by again.

Bishop Museum is a top notch museum and is in the same class as the Smithsonion. The craftsmanship of the building itself is worth the price of admission. If one is looking for Polynesian culture you will find it here, (ie spend your money at the museum, not the Polynesian "Culture" Center. Also, the food at the museum was fantastic.

We went by the Bishop sort of spur of the moment. An exhibit called "wearable art" was on display. It was wonderful. Inexpensive, a great way to kill a few hours

The museum is easy to find both due to signs on the roadways and our phone GPS app. We arrived at opening, paid the $5 parking fee and started with a morning tour with a very knowledgable docent. The main building is an awesome piece of architecture. Check out the loa woodwork in the doors, framing, stairs, etc. Impressive. All...

I have been here a total of 15 times and each time I bring someone different and have an amazing experience.

Used to be one of my favorite museums. But admission for three adults plus parking is $75! What are they thinking? Skip Econ 101? I understand they are having funding problems, but I do not believe this is sustainable.
Exhibits are beautifully presented and informative, but too rich for my blood.

The Duke display was fun and informative. And WOW (fashion design from New Zealand competition) was on display. Those two items made it worth it. Otherwise, it was OK.

Most peaceful surroundings and grounds invite becoming one with the experience. Guidance is available for understanding and appreciation.

Visiting Hawaii is much more than beaches, mai tais, swimming with dolphins, and rides in rented convertibles. review_list:
There is a paved walkway that follows a relatively shallow grade up a hill. (I still got a bit winded on the way up, though.) There are binoculars you can use for free. We saw whales. Good times.

This is an excellent hike! Paved the whole way up; 2 miles round trip. Be aware that this is very little shade. Go early as it gets very crowded. Parking can be tricky and difficult to find. Bring lots of water and wear sunscreen. Gorgeous views at every rest stop. We saw several whales on our way back down. Steep...

It's paved the whole way and doesn't have much shade, all uphill getting there so the way back is much easier. We were there in late January and saw several whales but they were far away. This is a lovely hike with beautiful scenery. It's easy in that it's on a paved trail, but it is an uphill climb the entire way. The parking is also easy and marked. We went on a Saturday morning and my brother who lives on Oahu said it was busier than usual. As other reviewers have noted, it's a paved trail that wraps around. Once you get to the wrap around, you can begin to see whales breaching off the coast several hundred yards away.

Wonderful views, great paved trail, excellent for whale watching, can hike the entire way to top or stop along the trail for many spectacular views. Very heavily hiked. Never leave anything in your car, put all belonging in trunk.

This hike is worth it. Very crowded parking lot. You will probably have to hike to get to the hike! Mostly paved hike. Great views. Lighthouse is pretty to view over the ocean. Can't walk up to it though.

Easily done in flip flops. Cement paved gradual climb. Take a picnic so you can enjoy the sunrise and binoculars so you can spot the whales!

The visit to the palace was excellent. Getting past the one overwhelmed clerk who was selling admission tickets, taking cash for sodas, and handling the non-existent will call was very off putting. Arrive well in advance of your reservation time to deal with the poorly organized ticket queue.

Though this is classified as an easy hike, the last 10 minutes are a little challenging especially for the elderly. We hiked it for 30 minutes with a few stops to take photos of the beautiful landscape. We saw wild orchids near the entrance and there were plenty of them. The falls itself is a little underwhelming as the water...


More  



Although short, my favorite hike in Honolulu, about a mile and a half, not that steep, very pleasant and cool. You can make an afternoon of it by visiting the adjacent arboretum, which while small is also lovely.

walking to the falls is beautiful. Like walking through the jungle on Gilligans Island. There are so many different kinds of trees and plants to look at including one large section of bamboo. At times the trail can be uneven and towards the top it's quite rocky and slippery so those with balance issues may want to be aware of...

Honolulu is in a midst of a drought, so sadly Manoa Falls was barely more than a trickle on a February Thursday. Being in admittedly poor physical shape, the trek was a bit arduous and long. More  



Since Hawaii is low on rain the falls were meak. Still a nice walk, dont wear flip flops, food tennies are a must.

After you reach the waterfall go left on the hike path that is labeled right there. It is about an hour and a half hike to the top of the mountain through winding and slippery trails but the view is awesome! There are so many beautiful sites along the way. So worth it!

title: Waikiki Beach, Honolulu
review_list:
The many stores and shopping areas and large crowds not puts Waikiki Beach just a bit above Los Angeles California. Get away to the local areas to really enjoy the island or go to the big island.

Waikiki beach is everything you expect. Beautiful bodies amid the fancy restaurants, expensive hotels, and high end shopping centers. Beaches, surfers and lots of ways to part with your money!

Busy beach, warm water, lovely golden sand not the black sand we have on the west coast of New Zealand, Went snorkeling and swam with a turtle

great beach.There are better sectors near the begining of the beach.
Found it calm and warm.
I can get crowded at tmes. Great views and sunsets

This is a beautiful public beach. You can access rentals for water sports, swim, lay on the sand, and have access to food and shopping. We went there several times. The sunsets are gorgeous!

Spotless, safe bathing, watch the surfers or just relax and people watch. Beautiful greenery and very picturesque!

Waikiki is so dated and not at all what you would expect when visiting the Islands.
Be ready for a big Metropolitan City, just like the San Diego. Theres traffic, expensive hotels, crowded, malls, buildings, and oh, yes... a beach with very small areas of sand shade trees. I would recommend skipping this and doing Maui instead, to get a...


More  



If you've ever been to the most touristy part of any international city and loved it, you will find the same on Waikiki. There is literally something for everyone who loves the tropics. You can take newborns into the ocean swimming pool (ocean surrounded by a cement wall that allows only the smallest fish in and out), boogy-board, surf small...


More  



When you dream of Hawaii this is the walk you want to take
At night is was so amazing and and safe to walk
Felt at home and was the walk of a lifetime, we walked for over 2 hours and really did not feel or notice it

If you plan on going into water Do not go from 5 to 8 days after full moon as the jelly fish come out!!,
Otherwise an awesome beautiful beach

title: Fort DeRussy Beach Park, Honolulu
review_list:
Walked past this part several times while staying at Waikiki Beach. Very nice. Good area for picnics and also to cut through while on a walk to see the area. Right next to the beach with nice ocean view

Walked through this delightful park wedged between Waikiki hotels and the Waikiki Beach scenes. They've done a good job of putting out markers describing military groups who have supported the troops. Saw alot of folks in the park early in the morning in contemplation in the relaxing and very quiet park area.

This big park had wandering paths through green trees and plants of all kinds. Flowers everywhere and birds that were not afraid of people. Our hotel was right next to this park, I spent a lot of time here taking photos of paradise and enjoying the shade.

Loved this quiet area away from the busy Hawaiian Village. Ate at the stand. discount beach equipment. bring discharge papers.

Nice park with nice trees and benches to sit and write postcards. Quieter end of Waikiki beach and nice to "get away" from the tourists.

This is an extremely nice park on the beach of wikiki with several high end motels and apts, eating establishments (DQ also), volleyball nets, and pure beach fun. We walked about a mile up and down the strip and watched volleyball and pickleball. There were many people walking the area, but not crowded. Seemed safe and was very lush and...


More  



Great display of weapons, uniforms etc.from WWIi, Vietnam etc. Many good articles about various things that happened during the wars.

Nice and peaceful park. Lots of shade trees and beaufiful gardens. Close to the beach. Military Museum near by. Grab a lunch and relax and do some people watching.

the beach is in a great location, chair rentals are reasonable, views of the water are great, food is nearby, I would go back anytime

We walked along the beach by the Fort DeRussey park several times. Nice area sometimes muddled by the joggers but good walk. Also provides a shortcut from the hotel to downtown area

title: US Army Museum of Hawaii, Honolulu
review_list:
Great location just off the beach at Waikiki, near the Hilton and Hale Koa. The museum is housed in a former bunker used in coastal defense. Portion of the museum is devoted to former Army Chief of Staff, Eric Shinseki, a native of Hawaii.

great little museum with well stocked, interesting gift shop. At the moment they have an excellent exhibit all about the role of many Nisei in the Military Intelligence Service during WW2 and what a huge difference they made - I thought it was fascinating and really well done.

We did not plan to visit the museum but were walking by, were very hot, and decided to stop in for a few minutes. It would up being a longer stay. I am a veteran so the museum was more interesting to me than my wife. While covering general topics related to the U.S. Army, the emphasis is appropriately on...


More  



We had one hour gap between after lunch and another activity. We were really just hope to kill some time at this place. However, we were amazed by how much we learnt about Hawaii & its history after the visit. It is free to visit this place, but make sure you make a some donation. We certainly did.

This free museum has a lot of interesting information. Most of the genuine relics are at Pearl Harbour and the new aviation museum but we learnt a lot about other conflicts. I especially enjoyed getting a bit more insight into the day to day lives of the participants.

Great opportunity to learn the latest slant on Pearl Harbor. NO BATHROOMS BEYOND A CERTAIN POINT YET THEY TELL YOU THE BATHROOM ON THE ARIZONA HAS BEEN "BROKEN" FOR AGES. People are guides as a herd. It is still an active cemetery. Carnival barker guy at front entrance tells bad jokes. Maybe it's a hard job.

This was a bit of a surprise as it focuses both on the Army in Hawaii but more particularly on the contribution of Hawaii's diverse population to the Armies efforts both at home and abroad.

Staff was very helpful and friendly. A must place for a visit with free entry. Great history display and history of the island. An education knowledge to learned.

Great museum to wander about in for a few hours and read up on historical events and also about the Hawaiian islands natives.

an interesting place to visit.The museum itself is built into a WW2 bunker.Very educational.A must for history buffs.

title: Honolulu Museum of Art, Honolulu
address: 900 S. Beretania Street, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96814 (Formerly Honolulu Academy of Arts)
review_list:
We did not have a car during our stay in Waikiki, but took the city transit that dropped us off at the front entrance of the museum. The museum of art had quite a lot of displays that covered major cultures, movements and periods of art. We were pleasantly surprised with quality and breadth of the collection. Highly recommend for anyone that appreciates art and museums.

I decided to go to this museum after I heard they had 2 Gauguins. I go there and find they house not only Gauguin, but also Monet, Gogh, Pissaro, Modigliani, Picasso, Lichtenstein, and the list goes on.
I also loved the paintings depicting scenes and people of Hawaii by Grace Hudson.
The museum itself and its courtyards are also very...


More  



Beautiful open air building (exhibits are in a/c controlled environment.) very nice survey of European, Asian, Pacific Island, and Middle Eastern art(Doris Duke Collection.) Special exhibits have been excellent. Recently enjoyed a look at Pop Culture fashion associated with Tokyo's Harajuku. Admission price is reasonable (unlike the Bishop Museum) resulting in multiple visits per year. This museum is a treasure...


More  



Even if the collection at this gallery was rubbish (and it most definitely is not), I would still recommend it. For starters, the building itself is remarkably beautiful, both from the outside and in. Inside, most of the galleries open onto leafy and serene courtyards, great spots to cool the heels and reflect on what you've seen. Occupying one of...


More  



The museum is situated in the middle of Honolulu, yet I'd only visited a handful of times before. I was invited to see the Rodin exhibit, which I really enjoyed, and enjoyed a delicious lunch in the Museum cafe. Afterwards, I explored the museum by myself and had forgotten how lovely & peaceful it is. I most often visit the...


More  



This museum is excellent. We bring visitors here all the time and they are surprised at the diversity and quality of the collection. The museum is situated around a court yard and is broken up into several rooms. Each room represents a different part of Asia. I.e. Japan, China, Korea, India etc. There are also European and American works of...


More  



Really enjoyed my visit here. It was well layed out and easy to see the different variety of artworks. I came here with friends we spent a few hours walking through. One of the highlights of the trip.

The museum of art had some nice pieces, and if you are really keen on Japanese prints and Chinese art, then this is the place for you.

We loved this art gallery. Fabulous art by some very famous artists. Some amazing art work from around the world surrounded by beautiful courtyards.

title: Tantalus Lookout Puu Ualakaa State Park, Honolulu
address: Round Top Drive, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96822
review_list:
We visited with our two children aged three and five. We drove to the top first and took in the views over Honolulu (magnificent). We then walked down to the trailhead. This is a quick but highly recommended stop on your drive along the Tantalus Scenic Drive. The overlook views of the broad panorama from Diamond Head, Waikiki, Honolulu and the airport to the west are awesome. Several panorama pictures are needed. Easy to find and adequate parking. It was not busy both times we stopped there. No fees. Restrooms in...


More  



if you've seen a great shot of someone overlooking honolulu, this is the place. an easy drive, easy parking, and never crowded; at least not for more than a couple of minutes. take your turn in the corner and get that great 'i was there' shot. then stay and enjoy cause you might be the only people there. if not,...

After leaving Punchbowl Cemetery we took the Tantalus/Roundtop Drive since it was just a very short distance away. You feel like you are far away from the city, even though it's only like 10 minutes away.
We took Tantalus Dr. Going up and then it changes into Roundtop on the way down. It's a beautiful, but very twisty turny road....


More  



We drove up the tantalus at around 9 pm. It was so dark and kinda scary to drive if you are not familiar. For tourists better hire someone local who is familiar if you wanna see the honolulu city lights at night. The view is beautiful and it was kind of windy and cold. This is a must.

The drive up is beautiful along an ancient rain forest with hairpin turns but take your time and enjoy the lush gardens.

This was a highlight of our day after visiting the Veteran's Cemetery. The road is not well-marked, but there were friendly residents along the way who kept us going. We also encountered many chickens or jungle fowl and were amazed at the houses in that steep and jungle-like mountain. We enjoyed seeing the variety of trees, even though we didn't...


More  



The ride up round top drive is a little scary but fun cause of the sharp turns. Beautiful views of Honolulu from tantalus look out.

Great place high up over looking Honolulu city. The views are breath taking and the breeze is refreshing. Great for site seeing.

This is centrally located on Oahu and there are spectacular views of the ocean and Waikiki. The temperatures on Oahu can climb to the upper 80's by the afternoon so you might enjoy this adventure more in the morning or late afternoon when it's cooler.

title: Saint Augustine by-the-Sea, Honolulu
review_list:
We attended the early morning mass and it was a beautiful service. We were greated and welcomed into the church. It was nice to not feel like an outsider/tourist. Everyone we met were very nice. The walk down Kalakaua Ave to and from the church was easy.

We attend Mass here whenever in Honolulu and find it to be a spiritual, beautiful ceremony/location. The priests are welcoming and friendly with excellent homily every time we have been there. Attendees are local, tourists, and homeless. Beautiful interior. Ushers are welcoming and sincere in their efforts to facilitate the ceremony. Thank you all!!! Highlight of my trip.

This church is a commination of Tradition and Polynesian.
Very friendly congregation,
Beautiful interior

Was pleased to see the church packed on a Saturday evening, sound system was a bit loud, but otherwise, the homily and service was top notch.

I pass by this place every time I'm in Waikiki and always wondered what it looked like on the inside. Took a peak and loved the architecture of the cathedral.

My wife and I always do our best to make it to Mass every time we are in Hawaii the services here have always been so beautiful and great experience in the native tongue and you don't have to be Catholic to enjoy and give thanks to the Big Guy for being alive and in Hawaii.

Attended a lovely mass on Sunday morning, while away from home, we felt very welcome and the church is beautiful.

I attended service at St. Augustine's the First Sunday in January. The service was 1 1/2 hours long. In addition the regular Mass, a Hawaiian princess was being celebrated inasmuch as it was her birthday. It was fascinating to hear participants speaking and singing in Hawaiian. The officiating priest was very Hawaiian. I found dancing the hula in church unique.

If your Catholic this service was beautiful wth a Hawaiian feel. The church is beautiful and singing is amazing.

Great location, beautiful spacious interior, and convenient Mass times. It is literally across the street to get to the beach! When we visited, we were pleasantly surprised at the number of people attending. St. Augustine's has a special welcoming appeal to it.

title: Magic Island, Honolulu
address: 1201 Ala Moana Blvd, At the end of Ala Moana Beach Park, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96814

Really not worth going to unless there is an outdoor festival or something planned. It's a great place for the festivals that happen because a lot of people can...


More  



me and my husband celebrated our silver wedding anniversary by renewing our vows here. the park is large and the beach is lovely.

The wife and I renewed our vows when we were here when we went on our anniversary trip this year. Beautiful place

Great place to visit, family friendly. Shops everywhere you turn. Restaurants too many to count. You can snorkel, paddle board, paddle boat or rent a chair and umbrella and just chill on the beach.

Magic Island is a quite nice park to stroll through at the western end of Waikiki a walking distance from Ilikai, and Hilton Village, If you come in the afternoon you get impressed with number of wedding couples taking pictures in this beautiful park There were 5 couples simultaneously being taken pictures of when I arrived. More  



A great spot for pictures but be there before dark. We walked from our hotel a few blocks away and got there just as the sun was setting and got a few pics. More  



I saw Magic Island from my hotel balcony and decided to walk there. It was definitely worth the walk. It was beautiful, patrolled, fairly unpopulated compared to other Waikiki beaches. More  



A part of Ala Moana Beach Park, it is very popular with locals, you will stick out like a sore thumb.
Really like it for my early morning runs and to watch the sunsets here and the Friday night fireworks at the Hilton across Ala Wai harbour.
Also good place for swimming, fishing, snorkelling , surfing and spear fishing.

Best beach in Honolulu. So under rated. I tell everyone to go there and no one does! It's quiet, beautiful swimming, picnic tables, shade....everything!!

Magic Island was built so that a resort could be built, But they ran out of money, Now it is a nice park to relax with a good view of the ocean,

title: Pacific Aviation Museum Pearl Harbor, Honolulu
address: 319 Lexington Blvd, Historic Ford Island, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96818
review_list:
Must be booked through Pearl Harbour, You must go on a tour as it is on an active military base, cant take your own car. Bus shuttles leave and return every 15 mins, You can stay as long as you like and just jump on a shuttle when you are ready, Closes at 17.00pm

You'd think that an air museum at Pearl would be great, but this was the least impressive aviation museum I've been to. Extremely limited number of WW II era planes. Minimal exhibits. Skip it - it's a waste of time.

The history contained within the Enclosed Museum and the Outdoor hangar is a must see for anyone who likes Aviation History. I highly recommend this for anyone.

This museum is included with the passport ticket and comes after the visit to the USS Missouri. The large air-conditioned tour bus will pick-up and take you to the museum on it's route. Timing is not a problem with frequent busses available. The museum is spacious and well laid out with planes and exhibits form the Pacific war. Take your...


More  



This place should be the highlight of your vacation!! So much history to learn. It was one of the most interesting places I've ever visited and trust me I've visited a lot of places. The food here is also very good. For a whole day of entertainment the price is also great! I will continue to visit here every time...


More  



Great experience at Pacific Aviation Museum. We had a guided tour which was extremely enjoyable! Our guide, Rex was fantastic!!! He had a myriad of interesting stories and facts. The planes were great to see.
If you go, make sure you walk out to Hanger 79. Will see original bullet holes in the glass panes from Pearl Harbor attack, and...


More  



I didn't think much of it at first but when I entered the hanger then I realized i knew more about those aircraft than I thought. You will appreciate being that close to all the different types of aircraft. They are also always working on restoration projects as you tour the hanger.

As a pilot, this was a must stop for me. There are not a lot of planes on display inside; several more outdoors. There are two additional hangars, but they were closed during my visit. The historical tower & grounds were touching to see. Amelia Earhart ground looped her plane here not long before her last fateful trip. The museum...


More  



There are a lot of restored war shop their store. in this hanger, many interesting facts of our previous wars. Also there is a place to buy lunch or

By itself, this relatively small museum costs $25 for an adult. Admission includes the audio guide. The museum is interesting but relatively small for that price. I would recommend going only if you love aviation or the ticket is included in a package deal (like the Go Oahu card for example).

title: Ala Moana Beach Park, Honolulu
address: 1201 Ala Moana Blvd., Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96814
review_list:
There are many other beaches in O'ahu that are way more interesting and relaxing than Ala Moana. Have to admin for some people this might be a better alternative than Waikiki Beach.

I live across the street from the beach. I see sunset almost every evening. It's a good place for kayaking, stand up paddling, surfing and even parasailing. You can take good pictures of sunset. Park is a nice place to sit down, watch the waves of the calm ocean and relax.

there is nothing spectacular or special about the beach here - more locals than Waikiki which is nice - no tWaikiki - which is nice.

This beach is more beautiful than Waikiki beach. It is also free parking, areas for BBQ, showers and toilets. It is much quieter than the busy Waikiki beach.Very short walking distance from the Ala Moana shopping centre with loads of shops and restaurants.

Its a fairly large park by the beach - its nice and quiet compared to the rest of Wakiki, and its ideal for runners.

Very, very nice. We spent three hours walking up and down this strip and also returned two more times during our 9 day trip.

Gilligan's marina is off the edge of the park. The park is large with bathrooms and nice access to ocean. Across the street from the Ala Mona Mall. Lots of options for food in the food court.

We walked to the beach from HHVillage. It was quite a trek. Beach nothing like Waikiki as it was full of small rocks. Lots of local families enjoying this beach. There is a lifeguard as well. Was ok, but wouldn't go back.

The park is very conveniently located right by the Ala Moana Shopping Center, very accessible. It's good for walking, jogging, and tennis. It also has a good size beach area by the water. Even if you don't play tennis, try to make a stop inside the Ala Moana Tennis Court, there are several lily pond landscape very pleasant to break...


More  



Stroll amongst the many that go to worship the sunset, meditate, yoga or just sit and relax. Wonderful ocean view.

title: Kapiolani Park, Honolulu
review_list:
Tired of walking the shopping streets of Wakaki? Fed up with the beach crowd scene? Then follow the easy accessible walk to this park. Not crowded, shady with grass and picnic tables. Great space without interruption to view the Pacific

We loved our walk to Kapiolani Park from our hotel at the other end of Waikiki Beach. There were great views of the water, surfing lessons, the reef wave break, and the gorgeous old trees. There were various easy smooth walking paths to choose from. Many people were out enjoying the park and there was even a Framer's market going...

Nice park area with lots of birds, close to Waikiki Beach.

This part was pretty well used while we were here. However,there appear to be a lot of homeless people living in and around the park. Most do not bother you a bit. Appears to be a gathering place for local families to have birthday parties, etc. Right across from the beach if you need to get out of the sun.

On Sundays the Hawaii State Band plays free concerts in the park. It is a simple walk from your hotel. They also play at the Iolani Palace during the week.
This is a large park.

We were staying at the Outrigger on the Beach and decided to take a walk towards Diamonhead. We walked on the sidewalk side to do some people watching and not have to walk in the sand. We ended up walking down into Kapiolani Park. We stayed on the sidewalk the entire time passing several beaches and jetties. It's apparent the...

Lovely park to get away from the sun. Stroll amongst the trees, enjoy the view. Have a panic or take a book to read and relax in the shade.

Family neighborhoods surround the park. It us a great spot to stroll and take in the kids playing, etc. You can hear the parrots that reside there nibbling and socializing on top of the tropical fruit trees. Great place to get away from city noise.

My wife and I enjoy taking morning walks through Kapiolani Park. Lots of beautiful shade trees to sit and relax under. There always seems to be some sort of activity or gathering taking place that may be worth checking out. The police patrol the area pretty often to keep the homeless from settling in and cut down on cases of...

The Center has undergone major changes bringing international branded companies but Long's continues to go strong. High end is Ala Moana. The food court has undergone a major renovation over time and increased the variety of offerings.

As a local who live here, Ala Moana Center is the biggest and also the number one shopping mall in Honolulu. The big department stores like Macy's, Nordstrom, Neiman Marcus and Bloomingdale's are here. Everything you want could be found here. I do my shopping here.

We went to this mall on a day trip to Oahu. We had not been there since part of the new wing opened and we wanted to go to Bloomingdales. The shopping center is way better than it was before! Only half of the new wing is open so we will be back when the rest if it opens.....I love...

When in Honolulu the shops along Waikiki tend to be more high end and thereby limited in choice. We went to the Ala Moana Center to waste time before our flight. We didn't do any shopping, but they did have some great brands. The Food Court offered a lot of options. We went to a seafood place located next to Charley's & it was awesome! Huge portions and the food was great.

More high end now than before but we still come to Ala Moana Shopping Center to shop and dine! Always been a part of our lives as locals!

title: Oahu Diving, Honolulu

We had a great time diving with Oahu Diving!! It was a first time experience for most of our group and we were all thrilled with it! Awesome experience. Instructor was knowledgeable and kept things simple and fun. Scenery was cool and many opportunities for great pictures. Instructor even provided many great photos of his own.

My sister and I had never been scuba diving before this trip. The Oahu Diving team made us feel so comfortable. They are so knowledgable! Tyler, Eric, & David make a great team :) We will definetly be returning to Hawaii to go diving with them again!!

Great hosts, and great time. Erik and the other dive instructors did a great job of providing preliminary training for first time divers and ensuring that everyone was safe and comfortable for the entire dive. My only regret is that the dives couldn't last for longer.

Eric was great working with our mainly first time divers ( 4 of 6) he handled them with care and paientce. He also took some great pics of our party

review_list:
Maria was very knowledgeable of the area, and took us to areas not known by others. Maria was very accommodating to all our needs and gave us all helpful tips for great quality photos. I'd highly recommend Blue Hawaii!

Our tour guide/teacher is Jim who was great at bringing us to beautiful spots for our sunrise tour. He taught me to bracket my photos to see what combinations are better. I finally learned how to get that waterfall shot. I told him if I get a few decent pictures, I would be ecstatic, and to me, I got a...

I took this tour by myself. If you're a mother who loves photography...you will love her. I'm still using some of the tools she taught me! The owner is sweet and informative.

Spectacular and educational tour of botanical gardens and more in the Honolulu area. The flowers were spectacular, even in January. Learned about the native plants of Hawaii as well as many beautiful imports that do quite well in this amazing climate! So many photo unique photo opportunities, if you are visiting Hawaii and enjoy photography, I recommend this tour!

This was a lovely way to spend an afternoon . Learnt some new tricks about using my dslr and got to see some beautiful parts of Oahu. Loved the small group tour . Great variety of places to take photos .

I took the Sunset tour with Marie one afternoon in December while my husband and son did their own thing for the afternoon. The tour was so amazing and beyond everything that I expected! If you are a Hawaii Five O fan it is worth ever penny and more!!! Amy was awesome in making the whole tour incredible! Thank you Amy!

We had a great time spending the day Lanai. He was an awesome guide, kind, humorous, and full of history. We got to experience the true Hawaiian culture. Thank you Lanai for such an awesome experience!

It is a good way for visiting some places in Honolulu.
Thank a lot Beau for the tour. It was a funny day.

title: Kuhio Beach Park, Honolulu
review_list:
An amazing place to sit and watch the sunset, or to play in the water but before you go out to Dinner sit and watch the sunset, makes for an amazing evening

At the Diamond Head end of the Waikiki near the statue of Duke Kahanamoku and that large banyan tree. Relax in the park, picnic, sit and watch the people, surf, swim, and join the crowds. Lots of food places nearby and catch the torch lighting, hula dancing and singing.

The place to be. Whether it's to swim, stroll,sit and read a book, just a relaxing place. Lots to see. A wonderful place to catch a show, the torch lighting, music, hula or the most beautiful sunset. We always go back.

A little gem in the middle of Waikiki. on the Diamond Head end of the beach and a very chill place. You can pick up some :Plate Lunch" at a local eatery, and make a picnic on the beach, plenty of picnic tables too, if you prefer not to eat sand :)

The beach is located direct behind the Kalakaua Ave and is a public ocean-side park near the zoo. During the day it is a bit crowded and closes at 11p.m. You can rent a surf board here if you want or just strolling along the Waikiki Wall which reach about 50m into the water. You also can walk from this...


More  



It's Waikiki beach so very busy, not really my thing personally. Over crowded and bouts pretty much sums it up. For all of you wanting to learn to surf do not book on line. Online is way more money and there are so many places to get lessons and way cheaper it's 60 dollars max and if you want a...


More  



Kuhio Beach Park is really an extension of Waikiki Beach - to the east. It is located very close to the zoo and the park. Really not that big, but less crowded than the main part of Waikiki Beach. There are plenty of vendors there if you want something to eat or to rent a surf board, SUP, or chair...


More  



It was a beautiful beach with sand rather than coral! It has a grass area as well to relax on! There are many activities which you can do with the family, including kayaks. The sunsets are absolutely beautiful as well! The surrounding shops near Kuhio Beach Park are great too. Only downfall, if you need to go to the bathroom,...


More  



It was a really nice, powder sand beach, with families, groups of friends, all having soooo much fun! many kayaks, too.

Be sure to bring quarters for the meters, they do check and the ticket is $37. Drive around till you find a spot to park.

title: Puu Ualakaa State Park, Honolulu
address: Round Top Drive, Honolulu, Oahu, HI
review_list:
Do NOT leave valuables in your car. Two cars were immediately broken into just before we arrived, the second incident that day.

I had lunch from here Feb. 10. The view was spectacular. My city tour came drove us here from Waikiki Beach. The entertainment was awesome.

Aside from the awesome panoramic views of Honolulu at the adjacent lookout, this is also a quiet small park with two picnic table. It was not crowded both times we stopped there. Both tables were available. Short walk to lookout past the restrooms. Quiet park. Well maintained. Police security there on one stop.

Traveled up, up, up to Puu Ualakaa Park via the Tantalus route, a snaking-back-and-forth drive through a lush forest-y area. Encountered several tourist shuttle vans on the way up, which confirmed we must be on our way to a noteworthy place :-) While marveling at the gorgeous views of Honolulu and all the way to Diamond Head in the far...


More  



i had fun riding my bike up there. great view and theres lots of trails you can hike to. theres also a tree house if you look for it and it has a nice view too. they used to have swing but they took it away..

Took the Tantalus drive up which was relaxing and quiet. Think 180 hairpins covered by old growth trees and gorgeous vegetation with hardly any traffic. The actual park is clean and quiet. I was there midweek and it was basically empty. I didn't picnic or hike here but checked out the overlook. An incredible view of Honolulu and Diamond Head....


More  



We visited this State Park as part of a private tour. A drive up the mountain, winding roads, but beautiful scenery on the way. Once you get to the top, WOW......spectacular. Great photo opportunity here with this gorgeous overall view. Go and check it out!!

We were doing the Tantulus/Roundtop Dr. As we were coming down from the Tantulus side we ran into the Puu Ualkaa State Park. Following Oahu Revealed instructions we took the 2 lefts at the intersections and ended at a great viewpoint! Wow! What an overlook! You can see about 1/2 of the island!
Go see it! Well worth the drive!

Had a wonderful view of Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach. No cost, but definitely watch your valuables in the car.

This is a perfect place to come during a hot summer day. It has many trails for the hikers to spend a day. Most of the trails are shady, which makes very pleasant to leisure around.

title: Statue of Duke Kahanamoku, Honolulu
review_list:
Great location...right on the famous Waikiki Beach! Perfect for a photo with the gorgeous beach, turquoise waters and blue skies for a back-drop.

It's location is fabulous, such a great photo spot, the view in the background is simply breathtaking.

Fitting statue of the Duke here near Kuhio Beach with his surf board. Winner of five olympic medals in swimming and promoter of surfing worldwide.

Great place to visit and understand the history to take in. Its on the main beach road in Waikiki.Great photo opportunity.

How can you not enjoy seeing this great statute of a world-famous swimmer and surfer. People hang their leis on his hands.

Beautiful statue of Duke with flowers and dedication mementos dropped by visitors in honor of this olympian master. Great place to begin to learn more about the strength of Hawaii.

I had never heard of him, and clearly he is very important to Hawaii's history . He seemed so brave and so friendly. Plus it encouraged me to go his restaurant after seeing his statue, ha!

Nice to see this statue on along the beachfront in Waikiki, if you are into history and statue you might enjoy viewing it.

What can you say, he's the Duke! You have to check out his restaurant nearby in the hotel, and remember his awesome raw skills!

Well what can I say,but,no visit to Waikiki is complete without a visit to see "Duke".I have been to Hawaii many times and never miss a chance to visit this iconic statue.Before we leave to come home,we make the pilgrimage to the statue to leave him our lei's that we have collected over the days...

title: Aloha Stadium Swap Meet, Honolulu
address: 99-500 Salt Lake Blvd, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96818
review_list:
We spent about two hours here going through the many, many booths. Admission is $1/person and is worth it just to see the many items for sale ranging from crafts to food to inexpensive souvenirs.

This is where you should buy all your souvenirs. My one regret is I didn't bring enough cash to buy some of the goods that Waikiki stores are selling for double and triple the prices. If you are also looking for silk flowers for your hair, come here, there was one lady who makes the most gorgeous flowers. I bought...


More  



We spent a week in Hawaii and went to the swap meet twice. This is the place to go and purchase all your souvenirs. Extremely cheep prices on the stuff you will find in every gift shop.
The venue is quite large, however the shops seem to be the same. Walk in either direction for 10 minutes and you've seen...


More  



If you like deals and open to a little haggling, this place is for you. Pretty much anything you want to bring home to family that you can find at the ABC stores you can get here and likely at a better price. If you get the munchies there's fresh fruit vendors, fresh coconut, and bakeries on site.
Go early...


More  



The vendors encircle the entire stadium. Goods range from toys to massage machines. Best buys that we found were some of the wood products. Be sure to barter on prices, as they mostly list the same price but some are willing to give a discount for multiple purchases. I was expecting food vendors with local fare but found little except...


More  



We went on a Wednesday. It's open on the weekend too. Maybe it's different on different days but once you've gone down one row you've basically seen it all. The rest is all the same stuff just different vendors. Good to visit once.

We did this on a Sunday after going to Pearl Harbor early in the morning, it took about 10 to walk there.
There were lots of souvenir type things, t-shirts etc which made great, inexpensive gifts. We were surprised how little food there was to eat though. Arriving around lunchtime we thought it would great to grab a bite to...


More  



If you're looking for Island treasures to take home or mail to loved ones, this is the best place to spend your cash. You'll literally find everything, including all the stuff you'll find in the beach shops, at a much better price. And haggling is to be expected.

Went specifically to grab some cheaper mementos and maybe find something a little different than what is sold at the ABC stores. Found it! For a buck you can walk around the entire circle of the stadium and grab Kona coffee, fresh baked Hawaiian bread and any fun little thing for a gift. There are a lot of T-shirt stands,...


More  



we took the city bus. almost 2 hours. then, a LOT of walking to get around the whole thing. its great if you want to pick up lots of T-shirts, trinkets, trash, junk, etc. I guess I am just over it. I bought a men's pinky ring, she was asking $ 70. and she took $ 35. just like being...


More

title: Royal Hawaiian Center, Honolulu
review_list:
They have restored this beautifully with lots of outside areas. There is a range of entertainment available through the day, entirely free and it's a lovely place to stop in. The food court has a range of options for all budgets, which you can then take out into the garden area and watch the shows. Great local music and dance...


More  



A beautiful place to visit with many photo opportunities in the Hawaiian garden where you can also sit to eat your lunch on bench seats. There is an upstairs food court which has a good variety of different cuisines to please all kinds of taste buds at good prices. Upmarket shops on 2 levels surround this amazing complex. Definitely worth...


More  



This is a beautiful mall. Redone a few years ago in such a tasteful way. It's so pleasant to visit the central garden where they host shows and exhibits. See it at night-magical. The mall is several levels with mostly high end stores. Top floor seemed to be mostly some enticing looking fine dining. But there's a good food court...


More  



The food court is an unexpected find for those on a budget. We had delicious and huge $10 lunches at Panda Express (Chinese) and $13 pizza's. The food court setting is also very pleasant, in a covered outdoor setting, clean and has a great atmosphere.

All the high end shopping experiences you could want are under one long three storied shopping building. The place is alive with shoppers from early morning till 11PM. The choices of food in the food court is very good and always busy.People are shopping, eating and browsing at All hours.

This place has everything:
1) restaurants and a food court 2) shopping (all sorts of brands and stores) 3) nightly entertainment (hula dancing, singers, shows) 4) cultural classes during the day (lei making, hula classes, quilt making, ukele, etc)
This place is very large...3-4 blocks long. Love the torches at night time :)
Every night in Waikiki we always end...


More  



Went to eat here a few times and found the found the food very good and reasonably priced.we bought a huge pizza for $13 and couldnt eat it all huge variations of foods in the food court.. Most of the shops were empty and so we walked around and enjoyed the gardens and loved the torches down the streets.

Great variety of stores from carts to entry level to high end fashion and retail. Very very picturesque exterior, beautiful gardens. Very nice restaurant area.

Went here late afternoon on a Monday. Ate at The Cheesecake Factory and then walked off the calories by visiting several stores including Crazy shirts and Honolulu ookie company.

It is a great place to walk around at night. I really enjoyed the tiki torches, the beautiful plants, water features, terraced restaurants and expensive shops and boutiques. Even if you don't want to shop there, it is worth walking around to enjoy the ambience.

title: King Kamehameha Statue, Honolulu
address: 417 South King Street Honolulu, Honolulu, Oahu, HI HI 96813
review_list:
We happened to come by this statue while driving around the main island and parked nearby, and sat in the garden area for sometime. Nothing extraordinary and can be skipped if you do not have time.

Located across the street from the Iolani Palace. Impressive statue and photogenic with good lighting. Difficult to see due to difficulty finding parking. All metered with some cash ($0.25 per 10 minutes) and some credit card acceptable.

It was very interesting coming across this piece of history right in town and knowing what had transpired in this place before.

Beautiful opportunity to learn about local history and how Hawaii came to be all that it is. Understanding of how Hawaii became a state.

Great place for the Hawaii 5 O fans. Great photos and attractions to see. Free entry, tight security before entry.

Classic stature of a great king and icon to fans of the Hawaii 5o TV show. It just says Hawaii to the rest of the USA .You just have to go here.

it's a great piece of history. i love visiting and just taking a moment to appreciate the Hawaiian culture

What can I say - the starting credits of Hawaii 5-0. Seriously though, the King was a nice guy and important to Hawaiian history, so it is good to see his statue there.

This statue and the palace across the street remind us of Hawaii's royal past. Kamehameha is gone but this will always be his kingdom.

We took the bus to downtown and saw the statue. Its a good statue to look at. Apparently we were there during the weekend so there were no people around at all.

title: Don Quijote, Honolulu
review_list:
I love this place! So many options to pick from, ready to eat, or cook at home items. My daughter loves all the treats and snacks. I can always find things to send to friends and family around

Yes, Spam. It's not normally on our list of favorites, but we on a quest. We were on the hunt shopping around the island in search of Garlic flavored Spam for a relative back home. We checked all the shopping centers on Oahu for days with no luck until a local tipped us off and directed us to Don's where...


More  



This place is something else I feel like I'm in another world They have unique items plus the fast food stands out front are awesome. We are staying in a condo nearby for the winter and this our go to place for everything

Stocked up on a few things down the street at Walmart but their produce section is pitiful. Followed the locals 2 blocks from Walmart and found this gem of a store.

This was an interesting little find in our explorations. We like to go to grocery stores when we travel, and this was a good one! I recommend going in, even if just for a look!

They have so many things you will see nowhere else. Also great fruits and veggies . A really fun place to shop.

Our first thanksgiving dinner, email contact with Liza enabled us to organize to order cooked meal online( though it was past the cut off date) and we were helped and welcomed by Kitty!!! SUCH GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE, this is why us Aussies love coming to Hawaii!!!!!!

I thought Don Quijote only exist in Japan but I was wrong! I was really excited to find one in Honolulu. It's like a Japanese version of Walmart but Its got a better selection of Asian products with great price AND it's open 24 hours! I find the macadamia nut chocolates here are cheaper than Walmart. I always buy all...


More  



Saw this online before we travelled. It was much better than expected. The souvenir section is awesome! You have to watch for their weekly ads and sales an fetch a great bargain. Huge selection of a lot of items. We were so glad we found this place. Definitely a great place to shop while in Honolulu.

I always like to shop here. It has great selection and plenty of varieties at very reasonable price. Their prepared food are also very tasty.

title: Honolulu Zoo, Honolulu
review_list:
A small almost boutique zoo with a great range and display - kids loved it and the weather was awesome - great way to spend the day - great location also - just a short walk from the beach and our hotel - we went to the beach and zoo in the same day!!

After visiting Pearl Harbor we needed something more appealing to a toddler and found the zoo a good distraction. If you have been to the zoos in St. Louis or San Diego, you will be disappointed, but it really wasn't bad for a smaller zoo.

We spent the afternoon here with our 4 year old child. While smaller than some other zoos, it is a great size.
The zoo is easy to navigate....with good signage. One would be hard-pressed to get lost!
While it is difficult to see some of the animals in the heat of the day (they must be sleeping/hiding), we were able...


More  



Going during off-peak season means construction, and that's fine. There's still plenty to see. Some of the animals simply weren't available to see, but there's a sign indicating closed exhibits before you pay to get in.
The parking next to the zoo is very reasonable. I paid $3 for 3 hours and that was plenty of time to explore the...


More  



good if you have kids as it doesn't take long to walk round and you can get fairly close to the animals .But don't expect a big city zoo experience

This zoo compares favourably with other zoos we've visited (Tarongo in Sydney, St Louis, Bronx). It is moderate-sized, on a flat landscape, and is easy to get around with a stroller. We have a three year old and five year old.
In addition, we liked:
- the open spaces of grass lawn where the children could just run
- the...


More  



The cost for family pass was reasonable. There are lots different kind of animal to see with a close up so that we can take a great photos with. A great place to visit for family and friends.

We came in summer and it was just too hot! The animals aren't very active as its too hot for them so come early morning or late afternoon. However there was a great variety of animals to see

In my numerous previous visits to Waikiki, I had never visited the zoo in the park. It is really quite nice. Almost all the area is shaded. There are numerous animals and ample description. I noted many families with children of all ages. It was a wonderful retreat from the hustle and bustle of the crowds, shops, and restaurants. There...

After viewing the sunrise at Diamond Head Crater we went looking for an eclectic breakfast at the KCC Farmer's Market. After the sunrise at Diamond Head we visited the Farmer's Market KCC.

You can also buy food ready to eat.

My girlfriends and I rented an Airbnb house and the owner recommended we visit the farmer's market which was just a 5 minute drive from our place. It was a nice local activity to do with lots of food and things to just look at. Worth coming for a visit.

It has been a while since our last trip to the KCC Saturday Farmer's Market but we went back this month to check out what's new. Never boring, we saw old vendors as well as new and interesting ones! As usual, it was crowded. Will go back again for sure and next time, we'll take our time and enjoy the...

I guess I was hoping for a bigger variety of local crafts, arts, and maybe music . It was all food. The farmer's market in King's Village and on the corner of Kapahulu is just as good , if not better. I was going out that way anyways, in search of the Thrift shop at the hospital ( which is...

After climbing Diamond Head on Saturday we headed over to the KCC to look around and ended up having a great breakfast. Made the climb that much better.

I went at 9:30 am and was still able to find a parking spot fairly quickly, although the road getting into the parking lot was a mess. The market was very crowded and there were only a few fresh fruit/vegetable vendors. I had been hoping for more, but perhaps it's the wrong season. If you're looking to try foods, this...

There was a lot of things here to see and buy, some of the stuff was flea market stuff, but there were a lot of cool things too, Lot's of local fruit

Worth a thirty minute walk around but be aware it is only small and very local. If you are taking the bus be aware that they only run every hour and will fill...

title: Waikiki Aquarium, Honolulu
address: 2777 Kalakaua Avenue, Waikiki, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96815
review_list:
Outdoor exhibit with a sea lion or two and a small tidal pool. Inside, lots of small tanks with themed exhibits, including sea horses.

Nice little aquarium, the exibits were well set up and the portable information system explains each exhibit clearly. The students who give the demonstrations with the monk seals are knowledgeable andhelpful and good with youngsters with lots of questions.

We went to Waikiki aquarium for a luau. Included in the luau price was free entrance to the aquarium itself. It is a beautiful place, well worth a visit when in Honolulu.

I'm 20 and studying biology and marine science, so I had a great time here looking at all the fish and reading all the information, it was very interesting! Not bad for a small aquarium, and an easy way to kill an hour or two :)

This aquarium is a short walk along the beachfront towards Diamond Head. make Sure your headphone works ( this aspect could be managed better ) before you start then enjoy! The coral and reef fish displays are fantastic. They have a magnificent giant clam...everyone including myself was amazed by this clam. You Will see Live nautilus and other exhibits not...


More  



Very educational and a beautiful aquarium displaying sea life from the area. Many do's and don'ts are explained throughout the building. No time limit.

The aquarium is located right by the beach, an easy walk from Waikiki. It is on the small side as far modern aquaria go, and limited space (and probably funds) suggest it is not about to expand. Despite its modesty, it manages to squeeze a lot into a confined area and there is quite a bit to see - taking...


More  



The Waikiki Aquarium is very small which might be surprising to visitors who think that Honolulu, with all its visitors and being right by the sea, should have a gigantic world class aquarium. This wouldn't be it though. Fish are generally poorly identified or mislabeled as we couldn't tell often what fish was what or were sure that they had...


More  



Very educational. Well worth it. Beautiful exhibits. Interactive as well. Reasonably priced. Fun for the whole family. Next to a beach park as well if you want to take a stroll after.

Have kids fascinated with the ocean and the many things that call the ocean their home? Take them here! Cheap for military and families.

title: Lyon Arboretum, Honolulu
address: 3860 Manoa Rd., University of Hawaii-Manoa, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96822
review_list:
The Manoa Valley setting for the Arboretum is stunning. The Hawaiian Ethnobotanical garden is particularly interesting. A great place for a relaxing walk.

Even though we went soon after a rain fall we still had a nice hike but at times slippery. Make sure you have hiking shoes on or at least sneakers. About a half day trip.

Beautiful flowers, and very nice gardens laid out. I didn't have time to explore them all, but what I did, was fabulous.

Take a stroll in an authentic Hawaiian Rain Forest full of local flowers, trees and birds. Well maintained by UH Manoa for the public to enjoy the natural beauties of our island. Just across the valley from where I have lied 32 years. Each visit is a treat! Often have amazing plant/orchid sales there.

Lyon Arboretum is situated at the end of a winding road behind Honolulu, in the Manoa Valley, an extension of the University of Hawaii, it has the charter to conserve, curate and study native Hawaiian plants, and the increase the appreciation of the unique flora of Hawaii.
Very pleasant to walk the many trails in the 200 acres, some quite...


More  



The arboretum has decent trails that you can hike even when it is raining. There are some interesting plants and a small waterfall to see.

We did an hour long walk thru and it is superb. MUCH better than Manoa Falls, which is really crowded with very limited views. Wear good shoes and take bug spray. Allow for 3 hours to really enjoy it.

Combined this with the Moana Falls hike, actually enjoyed this better.
Offered a pleasant, serene brake from the masses of tourists.
Give yourself plenty of time to explore the many side trails.
This is more for true trekking and nature lovers.
Wear trekking shoes and mosquito repellant (although the mosquitos were not too bad)

Best place in Hawaii to k ow the plants and nature. If you are interested in gardens, plants and nature this is the best place. This is good for a hike too that give a oder ate exercise. Entry and parking is free and they accept donations. If you are a botanist or wanting more details about th e plants...

We went expecting an arboretum. It was in fact a hike up to a waterfall with some beautiful grounds at the bottom. title: USS Oklahoma Memorial, Honolulu
address: Ford Island, Pearl Harbor, Honolulu, Oahu, HI
review_list:
We had a tour to the 4 stops in Pearl Harbor. Enjoyed the history and walking around seeing and feeling what veterans did while onboard.

Located away from the Arizona Memorial it is possibly less visited, and overshadowed by the battleship moored across the car park. Never-the-less the memorial is well designed depicting the crew of the Oklahoma at attention, a tribute to those that died during the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour. Make time during your visit to pay your respects.

while out seeing the sights of Oahu we viewed this memorial to the USS Oklahoma and her crew. Sad and somber moments thinking of all who died here on that day. Historic sights of our Nations history

This is at the same time really sad, and beautiful. If you have not been here you should go. I have to say though that it was really sad. Totally worth going. Definitely make a point and go. This place is a part of our history and I wish for all wars to stop immediately. When you are here you...


More  



A smaller but no less important than the memorial than the Arizona. This memorial is on land since the Oklahoma was refloated in 1943 and returned to the mainland.
The easiest way to visit this location is to take the shuttle bus from the Arizona to the Missouri and then walk.

If you miss the opportunity of seeing this it will be such a shame, but it wise to take a tissue, not make that a box.

Located on Ford Island, adjacent to the USS Missouri. Most tourists will need to visit this site and other Ford Island sites including the Pacific Aviation Museum as part of a Group Tour. The reason for this is that Ford Island remains an active part of the Pearl Harbor Naval Base.
As a Retired US Navy Sailor and Current NOAA...


More  



This is a wonderful memorial to remember those who died in and around the Oklahoma. Well worth a visit, just please remember to be respectful and ask those with you to be respectful also.

This memorial sits outside the entrance to the USS Missouri Battleship facility on Ford Island. Each standing marker represents a Sailor or Marine that was killed when the USS Oklahoma flooded and overturned after being hit by torpedoes dropped from Japanese planes during the attack on Pearl Harbor. A visual representation of the casualty count for this particular battleship, each...

The memorial is relatively small and simple but worth a visit. I lived near the garden for 2 months, I would go for walks everyday there. the air is so fresh, the scenery is so breathe taking, I truly enjoyed walking here. My granddaughter was able to just run and have fun in the grass and have fun. I can't wait to visit here on my next visit.

We love going to Moanalualani Gardens for the peace and beauty. Spent the day relaxing at the gardens watching the fish in the ponds and enjoying the peace and quite.

big open green spaces. Magnificent old trees to picnic under. Streams run through and lovely foliage to look through

If you want to know how it really feels to be in paradise this is the spot. Quiet beauty, lush plants surrounds me with beauty that you can't find at many places. The park is gorgeous.

title: Waikiki Beach Walk, Honolulu
address: Lewers Street, Between Kalakaua Avenue & Kalia Road, Honolulu, Oahu, HI
review_list:
The Beach Walk is a collection of shops and restaurants. There is an area in front of the shops that features a grassy area & fountain where at times there is Hawaiian entertainment including music & hula dancing. The shops feature artists from Hawaii. This is a place to shop & eat that I can afford, with beautiful surroundings.

Had a great walk along the Waikiki Beach and the swim in the beach was a lovely way to spend every morning doing.

Great walk, lots of people around, cafes' and shops. The beach was great and the people are friendly

Waikiki Beach Walk offers some beautiful views, especially at sunrise and sunset, and feels safe even late at night. We liked to grab a coffee and watch the sun come up here every morning. It gets busier as the day goes on, but not too much so.

At times I had flash backs of being in Times Square! This wasn't even the busy time of the year and the sidewalk was packed .

Great Swim with very clear water with a beautiful view. We stayed to watched the evening sunset which was around 4.45 pm was amazing.

It's a pleasant walk, not too difficult for the elderly , good level Boardwalk, with lots of hotels along the way

Enjoyed walking along the beach walk better than spending time on the beach. Streets were clean and there were lots of shops and restaurants/cafes that you could peek in to. Lots of areas to sit along the walk.

This place is just the best place on earth to be. Great ambience seeing people enjoying themselves in the sea or just sitting around on the beach. Loved every moment of it.

We were in Waikiki, a few years back and did not feel comfortable walking this street. The 2nd time it was starting construction, this time it was worth the wait. Just awesome. We walked this strip every evening. We ate at the restaurants, shopped, enjoyed the art stores and the entertainment. What a lovely place to walk.

title: Foster Botanical Gardens, Honolulu
address: 50 North Vineyard Blvd., Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96817
review_list:

There is a small shop but no food ,however the Chinese quarter is 5 minute walk away.
plenty of free parking

If you're interested in the flora of Hawaii, both indigenous and introduced, this is a good place to get an introduction to it. We went on a docent-led tour which was excellent. More  



Can't say I was overly impressed with this place. Seems a little run down and not very much to see. Some cool old trees, but that's about it

The gardens are modestly priced and if you plan ahead it is possible to have a complimentary tour with an experienced and knowledgeable botanist.
